resources.string: My Secret Blackpool
"The Regent Cinema\n\n reminds us of the effort designers used to put into building facades"
"Inside is the surprise\nas this building holds antiques and bric-a-brac enough for a full day's browsing . . "
"and upstairs you will find a Victorian tea room amongst the treasures . . "
". . And there is more . . \n The Circle seating remains and this antique shop, tearoom, still shows classic films!"

"Blackpool

The first seaside town with electric street lights.
 Blackpool Tower is famous"

"Don't forget the 3 Piers
The Funfair
The 'penny' arcades
The donkeys
 . . and the sand!"

"But, But But!
Beneath the glitter and faded glory,
 there lie treasures,
and here are my favourite . . 
SIX BLACKPOOL SECRETS"

"


>> More>> this>> way>>
"

"The Grand Theatre

 is a vibrant and busy place. 
Designed by Frank Matcham, theatre architect, the building outside and in is a show all to itself . . "
"Art Deco and a Mackintosh 'style'"
"The Grundy Art Gallery\n\n is a free to enter gallery showcasing local and international talent."
"This artist paints kaleidoscopic planets . . "
" . . and builds indoor piers . . this one is on tour!"
"The promenade\n can be travelled by modern, almost silent, tram . . "
". . but who wouldn't want to catch a\nHeritage Tour tram,\n some of them serve fish and chips!"
"The Winter Gardens\n originally a weather proof promenade,\n have been restored into an Art Deco masterpiece . . "
"Glass ceilings, Mazzei's Art Deco tea room, a statue of the entertainers Morcambe and Wise . . "
"and bar designed like a galleon 'ship of the line' and yet incredibly all that carved wood, is plasterwork!\n\n"
"Don't draw on the walls!\n Unless . . you are an artist . . "
" . . and you have been invited to Blackpool for their \nSand, Sea and Spray Art Festival"
